snippet: The company said on Thursday that it was beginning "strategic exploratory work" to sell off the division in an effort to help the e-reader business grow.
abstract: The company said on Thursday that it was beginning "strategic exploratory work" to sell off the division in an effort to help the e-reader business grow.
lead_paragraph: Barnes & Noble said on Thursday that it was beginning "strategic exploratory work" to sell off its Nook division, in an effort to help the e-reader business grow, DealBook reported. A spinoff, however, would raise questions about Barnes & Noble's future, however. While holiday sales tied to the Nook, including both devices and digital content, rose 43 percent from the period a year earlier, the company's brick-and-mortar sales rose just 2.5 percent. Read more at DealBook »

headline.main: Barnes & Noble Considers Spinning Off Its Nook Unit
